edu.cooper

Class TRPF

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cooper.TRPF

  • public class TRPF
extends java.lang.Object
    Keeps track of the Traffic Route Preference Function (TRPF) for each route for each round. TRPF = sum_over_weights(congestion_weight * num_users_reporting_that_weight)/num_reports = sum_over_agents(congestion_weight) / num_reports

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TRPF(int numroutes, int numrounds)
      Keeps track of the Traffic Route Preference Function for each route for the last numrounds rounds.

    • Method Summary

      Gets the TRPF of a specific route.

      Gets the TRPF of a specific route.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TRPF

        public TRPF(int numroutes,
    int numrounds)
        Keeps track of the Traffic Route Preference Function for each route for the last numrounds rounds.
        Parameters:
        numroutes - The number of routes that should be tracked.
        numrounds - The TRPF will be calculated using the reports from the last numrounds rounds.

    • Method Detail

      • newReport

        public void newReport()
        This method MUST be called before adding reports in a given round. It tells TRPF that we're on a new round, so it knows to put the reports in the proper place.

      • addReport

        public void addReport(int routenumber,
             double report)
        Add a new congestion report for a given route.
        Parameters:
        routenumber - The route that the driver just travelled and is reporting congestion for.
        report - A real valued number that kind of indicates how much traffic (=# of cars above SO) on the road.

      • getRouteTRPF

        public double getRouteTRPF(int routenumber)
        Gets the TRPF of a specific route. The calculation is:
        TRPF = sum_over_weights(congestion_weight * num_users_reporting_that_weight)/num_reports
        = sum_over_agents(congestion_weight) / num_reports The sum is done over the last numrounds number of rounds, where numrounds was specified in the constructor.
        Parameters:
        routenumber - You'll get the TRPF for route number routenumber
        Returns:
        The TRPF for route number routenumber

      • getTRPF

        public double[] getTRPF()
        Gets the TRPF of a specific route. The calculation is: TRPF = sum_over_weights(congestion_weight * num_users_reporting_that_weight)/num_reports = sum_over_agents(congestion_weight) / num_reports The sum is done over the last numrounds number of rounds, where numrounds was specified in the constructor.
        Returns:
        An array containing the TRPF for each route.
